snippet: The alliance will start the unit, to be made up initially of about 4,000 German, Dutch and Norwegian soldiers, mainly to deter potential attacks by Russia.
abstract: NATO says it will start nimble new response unit in 2015 to deter potential attack by Russia; rapid force will consist of 3,000 to 4,000 German, Dutch and Norwegian troops.

byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Moscow, and Rick Lyman from Warsaw.

lead_paragraph: The alliance will start the unit, to be made up initially of about 4,000 German, Dutch and Norwegian soldiers, mainly to deter potential attacks by Russia.

headline.main: Nimble New NATO Force to Take Form Next Year
headline.print_headline: Nimble New NATO Force to Take Form Next Year
